personal_work.description: A web app for Dragon Ball FighterZ enthusiasts, featuring a combo builder and Chrome's PiP API integration for realtime practice.
A Next.js project visualizing Twitter ratios, providing an interactive experience with downloadable, playful PNG cards.
An anonymous, temporary chat application for fighting game tournaments, enhancing live event engagement.
An AI-assisted mech building assistant for Armored Core players, leveraging OpenAI's GPT-4 for interactive user guidance.

responsibilities: Developed and maintained an ecommerce website, applying best practices in coding, documentation, and agile workflows to improve site efficiency and user experience.
Promoted self-teaching and pair-programming, contributing to team growth and better adaptation of emerging technologies.
Focused on delivering a high-quality user experience and accessibility, working with cross-functional teams to make the website more inclusive and user-friendly.
Improved website scalability and accessibility compliance by refactoring the frontend codebase and introducing TypeScript.
Led the refactoring of the webshop codebase, improving style reusability and streamlining development workflows.
Advanced frontend capabilities and trained the merch team, enhancing our content management system with Django CMS.
Managed product launches and webshop content, playing a key role in making the webshop the top revenue source for the company.
Designed web page components and updated assets, developing skills in CSS and HTML that improved website user engagement.

education.degree: Bachelor of Arts in Design and Visual Communications

certifications: Completed Just JavaScript, CSS for JavaScript Developers and Joy of React courses.
